history.content: Ready for another short session to compile the draft JOSS paper? If so, please set up a new session log.
A new session log has been set up for today’s work on compiling the draft JOSS paper. Ready when you are! What would you like to do first?

I want to add a reference to the Global Tipping Points report and introduce it. The report can be found here: https://global-tipping-points.org/ Viktoria is a o-author of part of this report. Global Tipping points are relevant to the application which we are developing GABM for.

A new section introducing and citing the Global Tipping Points Report—highlighting Viktoria's co-authorship and its relevance to GABM—has been added to the JOSS paper draft. If you need further edits or want to review the text, let me know!

Thanks, the way references are supposed to work with JOSS articles may have changed, but the journal used to recommend using the paper.bib file for these. Please can you adjust that last patch to use the correct way? I think checking if JOSS has any different requirments these days in terms of format is a good idea. There may be guidelines for content and things about process that we should be aware of. Is this something you cn check, or shall I look?

The JOSS paper draft now cites the Global Tipping Points Report using a BibTeX key, and the full citation has been added to paper.bib as recommended by JOSS guidelines. Recent JOSS requirements also include an AI usage disclosure and emphasize open, public development, so be sure to include these in your submission. If you need help with any other formatting or compliance, just let me know!

Great that you fetched that web content. I read about the AI acknowledgement. Did you see this. We should update the paper for this, but I want to include you as a co-author as we have done as I feel that is appropriate. It is nice to see that my friend Dan Katz is still involved with JOSS. I met Dan when doing my UK e-Science training. He is an inspiring leader in the RSE field. Please also capture our latest interactions in our session log.

The JOSS paper draft now includes an AI usage disclosure section, specifying the use of GitHub Copilot (GPT-4.1) and confirming human review and authorship. Your latest interactions—including your note about Dan Katz and the AI co-authorship decision—are also captured in the session log. If you need further updates or want to review the changes, just let me know!

Good work. As further background context for this work we need to introduce the 'Generative agent-based modeling with actions grounded in physical, social, or digital space using Concordia' paper and reflect on this and have it added to the bibliography/references: https://deepmind.google/research/publications/64717/

A section introducing and reflecting on the Concordia GABM paper has been added to the JOSS draft, with a proper citation and context for its relevance. The reference is also included in the bibliography. If you need further adjustments or want to review the new text, just let me know!
Thanks, the arxiv paper link is: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2312.03664.
The Concordia GABM BibTeX entry now includes the direct arXiv PDF link. If you need any more references or edits, just let me know!
Thanks, you had got that, I think I would prefer if possible and where avaiable to use DOI URLs. Please look for one and update our seesion interaction log.

The Concordia GABM BibTeX entry now uses the official arXiv DOI URL for citation. Your session log has also been updated with your latest instructions and preferences. If you need further changes or want to review anything else, just let me know!

Thanks. I am now with Ajay. So, I would like to end this session and we can come back to working on the JOSS paper later. Please update the session logs, and start a new session log for the second session of on-boarding with Ajay.
